meanings.sent1: She was encasing the precious jewelry in a safe box.

meanings.definition: To put into a case or covering.
meanings.sent1: He was encasing his phone in a protective cover.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was encasing the fragile specimen in a glass container.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to encase the ice cream in a chocolate shell for a special dessert.
meanings.sent4: The treasure was encased in a chest hidden deep underground.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully encased the delicate painting in a sturdy frame.

meanings.definition: The act of enclosing or covering something completely.
meanings.sent1: The encasing of the gift in colorful wrapping paper added to the excitement.
meanings.sent2: The encasing of the building in scaffolding indicated ongoing renovations.
meanings.sent3: The encasing of the cake in fondant made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The encasing of the tree roots in concrete caused damage to the surrounding area.
meanings.sent5: The encasing of the phone in a durable case protected it from accidental drops.
